result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason E. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason E. King in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Jason E. King in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  Plea to Count 1.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Tsai agrees and gives amount of credit to be noted.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
30 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  23 days credit.  TIME SERVED.
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Jason E. King in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Jason E. King in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for modification of bond.  Atty. Tsai makes argument - $100 Cash or signature.  State objects to modification.  Court states will not do a signature.  Court believes cash bond is appropriate.  Court will modify bond to $100.00 Cash bond w/previous conditions no contact KLD or her residence; may get belongings w/law enforcement

Pre-trial conference at 10-30-2015 09:30 am.
Return date at 11-13-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jason E. King appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney. DE does not qualify for PD representation yet.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond.   Atty. ORourke makes bail argument.   File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/KLD or her residence; may get belongings w/law enforcement  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
